reviews.review: O jogo √© at√© bom, o que fode √© a comunidade t√≥xica.
√â aquelas coisas n√©, a gente fala mal mas joga

[TLDR]

+ Game can be fun. Take breaks often.
+ Have mates? Play survivor with friends and enjoy.
But...
- Matches are too short resulting in burnout and no variety.
- Devs have a proven history now of not understanding what is fun about their game and act like university students following a textbook on game design (but they ripped the pages out about fun comes first).
- DLC and cosmetics are churned out at top priority. Game fixes take over 6 months. Pattern hasn't gotten better since 'Binding of Kin DLC'.
- DLC sales seem to be high despite community sentiment being "devs focus only on selling DLCs"
- (Personal Opinion) Purposely not balancing meta defining perks to create FOMO for people to buy DLCs (Circle of Healing and latest hex perks)

[Long description below]

I'm bored of it and I don't have any confidence in the game's developers. The fun part of the game is the chase, yet seeking out engaging chases results in the game being very short. So for me, it feels like the game is punishing me for trying to have fun.

When I play survivor, it's so fun especially when I'm chased by someone I'm on par with in terms of skill.
When I play killer, it's so fun chasing someone who is clever and resourceful without needing many 2nd chance perks. They're fine, but having more than one just makes me sigh and removes a bit of enjoyment from the chase.

However, games go by fast. There are many scenarios where the game finishes quickly and after a couple hours you've gone through a lot of disappointing or frustrating matches. Quick games mostly result in disappointment, frustration, or boredom.

- Disappointment: failed to even down one person. Feeling like matchmaking cheated you.

- Frustration: you feel like no matter how much you hit and run to build pressure, no one is injured. Circle of Healing... Should just enable self heal or only provide healing speed increase when healing others.

- Boredom: you got into a match with people that are new, and chases are over quickly. Match is over with 5 gens up.

Devs are slow and DBD has outgrown them in my eyes.
- They have a PTB that they literally refuse to use as one. It is used to simply preview DLC and that's it. Rather than test gameplay modifications, or radical design changes, or even number tweaking (beyond a simple +-1%).

- The sentiment lately from many players is they're no longer having fun due to many gameplay issues sapping the fun out of the matches.

- I can sympathise a little due to their platform support requirements. A patch submission for Playstation, Nintendo, and Xbox all to go out simultaneously isn't a simple thing. You can't undo a patch overnight for consoles if you messed up the design. But there's a PTB... They could literally use it as a playground for DBD. My theory for why? Their source control procedures must be poor.

Anyway... I'm disappointed in it and refuse to spend money on it. Have not bought anything for it since the Binding of Kin DLC (and I didn't buy that DLC). Including the resident evil DLC which has Nemesis who is one of my favourite characters. You know why? Because the only way we can influence the production of better games is to vote with our wallets. And I'm voting with mine.
This game fulfils my need to have a tall women vomit all over me.

Having only played the game for around a month now (I AFK a lot with the game open, so bear that in mind the hours played count), I enjoy the game for what it is.

I am terrible as survivor but am somehow ranked higher as survivor than killer.  The ranking and matchmaking systems (playing against survive with friends can be annoying but not impossible) aren't stellar.  Still, I enjoy myself most of the time whist playing.

üëç Diverse, fun and complex gameplay styles
üëé Large amount of salty and toxic players


As is the case with asymmetrical games, things can get really frustrating in the beginning.
Most players I faced are experienced and skilful, and the ranking system isn't effective.

I did get annoyed many times, and considered quitting the game for good. But something always drew me back, and I felt compelled to try again. After many unsuccessful attempts, I think I'm finally getting the hang of it.
This game does test my patience and persistence, especially with the skill checks.

It did start to get fun for me after a few matches. The game is filled with details and information on skills and perks.
A lot of work has been put into it, and, from what I've noticed, updates are released regularly.
This game has a lot of potential, and its popularity is well-deserved.

[As always, I'll continue to update this review as I see fit]

En lo personal me gusta jugar como killer, pero debo mencionar que si vas a empezar a jugar como asesino, te instruyas antes viendo tutoriales, gu√≠as o cosas por el estilo, pues en este juego ser asesino requiere de mucha m√°s complejidad que ser sobreviviente, pues necesitas conocer la funci√≥n de perks, jugabilidad, estrategias, y sobre todo....luchar contra el Genrush. El √∫nico inconveniente que le pondr√≠a al juego es la cuesti√≥n del Balanceo, pues muchas veces la balanza est√° a desfavor del killer, provocando que hagan cosas que pueden parecer "t√≥xicas", pero en realidad es porque muchas veces es necesario; pero por lo dem√°s resulta muy disfrutable y bastante adictivo, en especial si juegas con amigos :3

To be honest the game itself isn't that bad, besides the occasional buggy gameplay and glitches. The worst part of this game is the god awful toxic community. Can't do anything or say anything in the game without risking offending someone, and don't even get me started on killer main twitch streamers. They think they're so much better than everyone else, when in reality most of them are social rejects who use this game to release their pent up aggression from being outcasts.
